news.title: Human remains found during search for missing boy in Donabate as gardaí name child
news.summary: Gardaí searching for a boy who has been missing for four years have discovered human remains.

news.title: Young driver has no recollection of crash in which daughter died beside her parents, inquest told
news.summary: A yound driver who cannot explain how her car crossed on to the wrong side of the road told the family of a woman who died in the resulting collision that she thinks of them all the time.

news.title: Jim Gavin will need civil servants to guide him on Áras role if he becomes president, says Leo Varadkar
news.summary: Jim Gavin will need help from civil servants on the political and legal aspects of the role if he becomes president, Leo Varadkar has said.

news.title: EU Commission proposes sanctioning Israel and suspending free-trade agreement over Gaza war
news.summary: The European Commission on Wednesday proposed to suspend free-trade arrangements on Israeli goods due to the war in Gaza, even though the measure does not currently have sufficient support among the European Union's member countries to pass.

news.title: Coroner criticises Health and Safety Authority over inquest into man’s death after ambulance caught fire outside hospital
news.summary: A coroner has sharply criticised the Health and Safety Authority over its dealings with an inquest into the death of an elderly Kildare man who sustained fatal injuries after an ambulance turned into a fireball outside Naas General Hospital almost a decade ago.

news.title: Female teacher says sex with former student was ‘one-night stand between consenting adults’
news.summary: A female teacher who had sex with a former student in a hotel has denied that she “groomed” him, saying it was a one-night stand between “consenting adults” and she did not think it was wrong at the time.

news.title: Ploughing in pictures: Tea and tractors in Tullamore for day two of the national championships
news.summary: The second day of the National Ploughing Championships took place in Tullamore today, with around a quarter of a million people expected to attend over the three-day event.

news.title: ‘Of course I want to be an F1 driver. How and when that happens I don’t know’ – Alex Dunne has his eyes set on top table
news.summary: Rodin Motorsport's Alex Dunne is a rising star in the Irish motorsport world. The 17-year-old is currently the youngest driver in the F1 world's top 10. Dunne has just completed his first season in the top-flight of motorsport.

news.title: My self-build story: ‘The design and lightweight materials meant I could work away myself. It was just me, a ladder and a single-storey log cabin’
news.summary: Could you live in a mobile home for five years while your dream home was being built? If so, you could live in one for up to five years at a time.

news.title: Chef JP McMahon: ‘Americans will spend €500 or €600 and leave zero tip because they’ve been told Ireland doesn’t have a tipping culture’
news.summary: Opening your first restaurant as the world plunges into economic meltdown likely isn’t the most stress-free way to go about things, but that’s the hand that JP McMahon was dealt back in 2008 when he brought Cava Bodega to life in Galway.
